content:
• Monday, January 9, 2017
  • ILMN

    Illumina introduces new DNA sequencer that could enable a $100 genome

    • Illumina (NASDAQ:ILMN) +16.8% AH after saying it is launching a new DNA sequencer with new architecture it says eventually could push the cost of decoding a human genome to as low as $100.
    • ILMN says the new DNA sequencers, NovaSeq 5000 and NovaSeq 6000, have lower per sample consumable costs for most sequencing applications than the company's other sequencing systems.
    • ILMN says the NovaSeq Systems will open up new markets by making routine a wide range of applications, such as ultra-deep sequencing of matched tumor-normal pairs and large-scale variant discovery studies associated with complex diseases.
    • #JPM17
     
     
     
     
    | 6:17 PM | 22 Comments
  • ROKA

    Roka Bioscience takes off, up 26% in late trade

    • After heavy volume today (355K shares vs. a typical 78K), Roka Bioscience (ROKA +7%) is on a run, up another 26.5% after hours.
    • The nanocap deals in molecular diagnostics for the detection of pathogens that cause foodborne illnesses, offering the Atlas instrument and Atlas Detection Assays to find foodborne germs. It's moving on no particular news, however.
    • On Friday, Roka filed a 13G/A showing that Craig Drill and affiliated funds no longer held an interest in the company.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:53 PM

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: ILMN +10.2%. CUDA +7.3%. ARRY +3.2%. CNDT +2.4%. VOXX +1.9%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: WMB -7.1%. FRSH -7.1%. WPZ -6.5%. WDFC -6.2%. ATW -5.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 4 Comments
  • WMB

    Williams to increase stake in MLP, hikes dividend, launches 65M-share offering

    • Williams Cos. (NYSE:WMB) -7.1% and Williams Partners (NYSE:WPZ) -6.3% AH after the companies announce a plan to increase WMB's ownership of WPZ to 72% and for WMB to buy additional WPZ units in a private placement.
    • WMB says it is raising its dividend by 50% to $0.30/share, adding it will target 10%-15% annual growth "over the next several years."
    • WMB also launches a 65M-share public offering, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional 9.75M common shares; proceeds will be used to purchase newly issued common units in WPZ at ~$36/unit.
    • Effective with the quarterly distribution for the quarter ending March 31, WPZ expects to pay a $0.60 distribution, down 29% from its expected Q4 2016 distribution of $0.85.
    • WMB now expects that WPZ will not be required to access the public equity markets "for the next several years," with debt reduction resulting in an improved cash coverage ratio to ~1.2x in 2017 and in excess of 1.1x thereafter.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:25 PM | 82 Comments
  • ZLTQ

    Zeltiq expects 2016 top line of $354M, as much as $425M this year; shares ease 3%

    • Zeltiq Aesthetics (NASDAQ:ZLTQ) is off 3% after hours on average volume on the heels of its release of preliminary Q4 and full-year results and outlook for 2017.
    • Revenues for Q4 and 2016 should come in at $104.5M (+34%) and $354M (+39%), respectively.
    • Final results will be released at the end of February.
    • 2017 guidance: revenues: $415M - 425M, international revenues: 22% of total, consumables revenues: ~60% of total; gross margin: 70.5 - 71.0% of revenues; non-GAAP EBITDA: 11 - 12% of total.
    • Chief Mark Foley will deliver a corporate presentation tomorrow, January 10, at 10:00 am PT at JPM17.
    • #JPM17
     
     
     
     
    | 4:52 PM | 1 Comment
  • CUDA

    Barracuda Networks +6.2% after Q3 beats with subscription growth

    • Barracuda Networks (CUDA +4.4%) is up 6.2% in late trading after beating on top and bottom lines in its fiscal Q3 earnings.
    • Revenue rose nearly 11% and subscription revenue increased 17%, to $68.3M, making up 77% of total revenue. Appliance revenue dipped to $20.5M from the prior year's $21.7M.
    • Gross billings came to $100.4M, up from a year-ago $89M. Billings from core products beat company expectations, rising 30% to $61.6M.
    • Active subscribers grew about 15% to more than 309,000; dollar-based renewal rate was 90%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:51 PM
  • HQY

    Big session for HealthEquity on conference presentation

    • The company's presentation gets underway at 5:30 ET, but the slides were made public earlier today and they show the number of network partners growing to 671.
    • This includes 584 large employers, up 35%, and 87 health plans, up 9%.
    • HQY +6.2% on the session.
    • #JPM17
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM
  • HALO

    Halozyme down 5.9% after hours on 2017 guidance

    • Halozyme (NASDAQ:HALO) rose 6.4% in the regular session amid strong action in the oncology sector after Takeda's purchase of Ariad, but it's lower by 5.9% after hours following the disclosure of guidance ahead of its JPMorgan Healthcare Conference presentation.
    • Full-year 2017 revenue is seen at $115M-$130M, excluding any new ENHANZE global collaboration and licensing agreements that may be signed during the year. The company expects to report $20M in 2016 revenue for reimbursed partner expenses that will not recur in 2017.
    • Operating expenses are seen at $240M-$250M this year to support the ongoing Phase 3 study for PEGPH20.
    • Year-end cash balance is seen at $100M-$110M.
    • The company presents at 6 ET.
    • #JPM17
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 13 Comments
  • FRSH

    Papa Murphy's -5.7% after hours on sluggish numbers

    • Same-store sales are seen as down 7.8% during Q4 and 5.2% for the full year.
    • The company did open 27 new stores during Q4, bringing full-year openings to 104 vs. 99 opened in 2015.
    • FRSH -5.65% after hours
     
     
     
     
    | 4:20 PM
  • VOXX

    VOXX International EPS in-line, misses on revenue

    • VOXX International (NASDAQ:VOXX): FQ3 EPS of $0.24 in-line.
    • Revenue of $198.9M (+3.3% Y/Y) misses by $5.1M.
    • Shares +7.5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:17 PM
  • ATW

    Atwood Oceanics to launch 13.5M-share offering

    • Atwood Oceanics (NYSE:ATW) -5.9% AH after announcing a public offering of 13.5M common shares, with an underwriters option to purchase up to an additional ~2M shares.
    • ATW says it plans to use the proceeds for general corporate purposes, including the repayment of borrowings under its credit facility, the funding of future purchases of outstanding 6.5% senior notes due 2020, working capital and capex, and otherwise to enhance liquidity.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 15 Comments
  • CUDA

    Barracuda Networks beats by $0.08, beats on revenue

    • Barracuda Networks (NYSE:CUDA): FQ3 EPS of $0.22 beats by $0.08.
    • Revenue of $88.8M (+10.9% Y/Y) beats by $2.21M.
    • Shares +5%.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • EGLT

    Egalet gives up gains after resuming trade

    • Up more than 15% at the trading halt, and then rising more than 25% shortly after resuming action, Egalet (OTC:EGLT -1.5%) has now given up those gains and turned negative on the session.
    • At issue could be the label as the FDA announcement didn't say whether the company had been granted the important "abuse-deterrent" label.
    • Shares appear to be under another volatility halt.
    • Previously: Egalet confirms ARYMO ER approval, expects commercial launch this quarter (Jan. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:33 PM | 50 Comments
  • DPLO

    Diplomat Pharmacy's softer 2016 guidance pressures shares, down 5%

    • Diplomat Pharmacy (DPLO -4.9%) eases on average volume in response to its announcement that it expects 2016 revenues and EBITDA to be at or near the low end of its announced ranges.
    • Chairman & CEO Phil Hagerman admits it was a tough year and adds that 2017 doesn't look much better as far as growth is concerned.
    • Concurrently, the company announces that it has inked an agreement to acquire Houston, TX-based Affinity Biotech, a specialty pharmacy and infusion services firm focused on hemophilia patients, for $16M in cash and up to $4M in additional contingent consideration. Affinity booked $27M in revenue in 2016. Non-GAAP EBITDA was $3M. The deal should close next month.
    • #JPM17
     
     
     
     
    | 3:17 PM | 12 Comments
  • UCTT

    Ultra Clean Holdings skyrockets after lifting its Q4 revenue guidance

    • Ultra Clean Holdings (NASDAQ:UCTT) now expects revenue for Q4 to be ~$173.0M vs. a consensus of $149.0M and previously announced guidance in the range of $146.0 - $151.0M, due to additional customer orders received during the quarter.
    • The Company expects to release its Q4 and FY16 results on Feb. 22, 2017 after market close.
    • Shares +12%
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM | 1 Comment
  • EGLT

    Egalet confirms ARYMO ER approval, expects commercial launch this quarter

    • The FDA's approval triggers the release of $40M in new funding to the company from the second tranche of last August's senior secured debt round.
    • ARYMO ER has been approved in three dosage strengths - 15 mg, 30 mg, and 60 mg. Commercial launch is planned for this quarter.
    • A conference call is set for this evening at 8:15 ET.
    • OTC:EGLT remains under trading halt, up 15.45%.
    • Previously: Egalet +15%; shares halted on FDA approval (Jan. 9)
    • Update at 3:17: The trading halt is supposed to come off at 3:30 ET.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:07 PM | 41 Comments
  • NBY

    NovaBay sees 171% jump in 2016 revenues; shares ahead 8%

    • Thinly traded nano cap NovaBay Pharmaceuticals (NBY +7.6%) perks up on slightly higher volume in response to its release of preliminary Q4 and full-year results.
    • It expects revenues of $3.8M (+146%) and $11.8M (+171%), respectively, for the two periods. Final results will be released in March.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:04 PM | 3 Comments

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: DDD +16%. XGTI +15%. ASUR +14%. CYBE +14%. UCTT +13%.

  • CRK

    Comstock Resources inks Haynesville shale joint venture

    • Comstock Resources (CRK -3.3%) says it has entered into a joint development venture with USG Properties to target the Haynesville shale in Louisiana and Texas.
    • CRK says it will operate wells on acreage recently acquired by USG and manage the drilling program in exchange for a 12.5% working interest in the acreage; CRK can acquire an additional 12.5% interest in each well drilled by reimbursing USG for acreage costs.
    • With the addition of the venture, CRK revises its 2017 capital budget to $168.5M and anticipates drilling 24 Haynesville shale wells in 2017.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:52 PM
  • EXEL

    Big day for Oncology players after Ariad sale, Merck/Incyte deal

    • NewLink Genetics (reported earlier) , Exelixis (EXEL +13.9%), Clovis Oncology (CLVS +8.5%), Loxo Oncology (LOXO +7.1%), and Array BioPharma (ARRY +4.6%) are among those with their tails in the air after Takeda takes out Ariad for a 75% premium to Friday's close.
    • Also of news in the sector is Incyte's expanded cancer collaboration with Merck.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:51 PM | 20 Comments
  • HOME

    At Home Group updates guidance in front of ICR talk

    • At Home Group (HOME +3.6%) announces that it expects sales for FY17 to increase ~22% to a range of $758M to $761M.
    • Comparable store sales are seen rising 3.0% to 3.2%.
    • FY17 EPS guidance is narrowed to $0.55 to $0.57. A lower tax rate and share count are positive factors for EPS.
    • The company formally presents at ICR tomorrow.
    • #ICR17
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • ET

    WSJ: Blackstone's deal for Energy Transfer asset stake collapses

    • Talks have fallen through, according to the report, and this morning's $568M private placement from Energy Transfer Partners (ETP -2.1%) was in lieu of the Blackstone (BX -0.6%) deal.
    • Energy Transfer Equity (ETE -5.3%)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:46 PM | 72 Comments
  • HCA

    HCA leads hospitals higher after preliminary results

    • Ahead of its presentation today at the JPMorgan Healthcare Conference, HCA (HCA +3.2%) announced preliminary full-year adjusted EBITDA of $8.2B, inline with consensus estimates.
    • Q4 same-facility admissions up 1.6% Y/Y; same-facility equivalent admissions up 1.5%; same-facility emergency room visits up 1.6%.
    • Full results and 2017 guidance are due on Jan. 31.
    • Presentation slides
    • Commenting, Mizuho's Sheryl Skolnick says HCA is gaining at the expense of weaker players, "but at some point, even the best house can’t shine as brightly on a dingy block." She notes a "concerning pattern" of declining ER visit growth, and declines in long-term inpatient volume as "the real worry" for hospitals." Source: Bloomberg
    • Also holding court at JPM, Tenet Health (THC +4.7%) CEO Trevor Fetter says 1.5% of revenue and 1% of admissions are at risk if the Obamacare exchanges end.
    • Presentation slides
    • #JPM17
     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM | 2 Comments

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: BCEI +23%. GORO +11%. URRE +10%. PVG +9%. BPT +8%.
    • Losers: CDXC -14%. UNT -9%. AREX -8%. GST -7%. EGY -7%.

  • NVDA

    Jefferies increases to $125 Nvidia target

    • Analyst Mark Lipacis moves from $110 prior, citing increasing confidence in firm's projection for 3-year EPS power of $6, as self-driving car competition indicates to be heating up subsequent formation of autonomous vehicle collaborations with Audi and Mercedes-Benz disclosed at CES 2017. Further notes deals previously struck with Tesla (October 2016) and Volvo (January 2016).
    • Retains Nvidia (NVDA +3.7%) at Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:35 PM | 18 Comments
  • MTLS

    Pacific Crest Securities reissues Materialise at Overweight

    • Projecting Materialise to be "the fastest-growing company in 3D printing this year," analyst Weston Twigg highlights recent collaboration with Siemens and discussions held with GE indicating Materialise will remain a robust industry partner. Restates target at $10 (current price $7.30).
    • As various 3D issues trade notably higher today, Materialise (NASDAQ:MTLS) shares are resisting rally participation and are to this point lower by 1.75% on the session.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM | 2 Comments
  • AMAG

    AMAG Pharma -35%; Raymond James downgrades

    • Risk/reward is skewed to the downside thanks to another Makena autoinjector snag, says analyst Christopher Raymond, downgrading AMAG Pharmaceuticals (AMAG -35.2%) to Underperform.
    • The primary source for AMAG's growth and cash flow, Makena loses orphan drug status in February 2018, and the company is discontinuing the comparative pain study for the autoinjector that was supposed to be the main differentiator between Makena and generics.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: AMAG 2016 top line may be a bit light versus consensus; shares ease 11% premarket (Jan. 9)
    • The company presents at the JPMorgan Healthcare Conference tomorrow at 2:30 ET.
    • #JPM17
     
     
     
     
    | 1:07 PM

  • AAPL

    Apple a top pick at Morgan Stanley

    • Considering focus to be "too much on near-term supply chain noise" and not sufficiently on "iPhone supercycle" (views China aspect of iPhone debate more so opportunity than risk), prospective cash repatriation and U.S. tax reform catalysts, analyst Katy Huberty reissues Apple at Overweight on a $148 target.
    • Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL) +1.05% at $119.14.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:53 PM | 111 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: ETRM +85%. ARIA +73%. WOOF +28%. BCEI +27%. NLNK +21%. SXE +20%. EXAS +20%. CYBE +17%. SCAI +16%. OTC:EGLT +15%.
    • Losers: AMAG -35%. SSI -17%. CDXC -17%. DXLG -15%. AYI -15%. AQXP -14%. EGRX -14%. ADHD -13%. MSDI -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 22 Comments
  • ESPR

    Esperion launches CVOT study of cholesterol fighter bempedoic acid; shares up 2%

    • Thinly traded micro cap Esperion Therapeutics (ESPR +1.7%) perks up on more than triple normal volume, albeit on turnover of only 716K shares, in response to the initiation of a global cardiovascular outcomes trial (CVOT) assessing the effects of bempedoic acid on the occurrence  of major CV events in patients with or at high risk of cardiovascular disease who are considered "statin intolerant."
    • The large-scale trial, called CLEAR, will enroll ~12,600 subjects across 600 sites in 30 countries and will run almost five years. The treatment duration will be 3.5 years. If all goes well, the company expects to file marketing applications in the U.S. and Europe by 2022.
    • Bempedoic acid is a small molecule that lowers cholesterol without the side effects associated with statins. Once in the liver, it converts into a derivative coenzyme which directly inhibits an enzyme called ATP citrate lyase (ACL) which plays a key role in cholesterol and fatty acid synthesis.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • EGLT

    Egalet +15%; shares halted on FDA approval

    • The FDA has approved the NDA for ARYMO.
    • OTC:EGLT +15.55% and currently halted from trade.
    • Previously: FDA informs Egalet that tomorrow's action date for ARYMO ER won't be met; shares down 12% after hours (Oct. 13, 2016)
    • Previously: FDA panel backs approval of Egalet's abuse-resistant painkiller (Aug. 5, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 96 Comments
  • HLTH

    Nobilis buys Texas-based vascular discease therapy provider for $13.25M

    • Nobilis Health (HLTH +2%) agrees to acquire Hamilton Vein Center for $13.25M in cash and debt. The provider of clinical and surgical procedures for vascular disease has four locations in the Houston area, one in San Antonio and one in Austin, the latter two represent new markets for Nobilis.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:31 PM | 2 Comments
  • BOJA

    Fast-casual names BOJA, ZOES and NDLS slump into ICR

    • Investors in Bojangles (BOJA -4.5%), Noodles (NDLS -3.4%) and Zoe's Kitchen (ZOES -8.1%) appear to be taking cover ahead of presentations at the ICR Conference.
    • Some analysts are expecting restaurant companies to lower Q4 and FY17 guidance this week at the event.
    • #ICR17
     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 1 Comment
  • BHC

    Hope for Valeant after Takeda buys Ariad?

    • Takeda's $5.2B purchase of Ariad Pharma this morning might mean a possible deal for Salix or any other Valeant (VRX) assets is off the table, but Takeda CEO Christophe Weber - in an interview at the JPMorgan Healthcare Conference - says there are "potentially" more deals to come.
    • He acknowledges looking at Salix, but doesn't comment beyond that.
    • After opening lower, Valeant is now up 1.45% on the session.
    • #JPM17
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 111 Comments
  • ORCL

    Oracle top 2017 large-cap software pick at UBS

    • Analyst Brent Thill considers sentiment and estimates on Oracle at low points and views shares as poised to move nearer to firm's $45 target (current price $39.43) as the company moves all-in on cloud, has yet to realize multiple expansion related to EPS estimates inflection, and EPS and free cash flow stabilize amid cloud revenue trajectory improvement.
    • Rates Oracle (ORCL +2.3%) at Buy.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 4 Comments
  • CTIC

    CTI BioPharma +10% after presenting progress and plans

    • Recent progress: The FDA this month removed the full clinical hold on studies under the IND application for pacritinib. Also this month, the company received a €7.5M milestone payment for Servier following a milestone associated with patient enrollment in the Phase 3 PIX306 tiral of Pixuvri.
    • Among the key objectives for this year: Advance Marketing Authorization Application in E.U. and define regulatory pathway in U.S. for pacritinib; Initiate PAC203 trial (intended for Q2); Secure ex-U.S. partner for pacritinib; Release top-line results of PIX306 (expected by year-end).
    • Cash and equivalents on hand at year-end was about $44M (prior to the above-mentioned milestone payment). Cash burn this year is expected to be $65M-$75M. Existing cash and further partnerships should be enough to get through the year, says the company.
    • Full release
    • #JPM17
    • CTIC +10.55%
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 5 Comments
  • URBN

    Mall retailers bounce back from ICR anxiety

    • Mall retailers are bouncing back after alarming drops in share price at the end of last week.
    • The mild recovery is taking place in spite of a margin warning from Urban Outfitters (URBN -2.4%) in front of the ICR Conference.
    • A decent update from Francesca's (FRAN +8%) on Q4 sales may be helping to lift sentiment.
    • Gainers include Cato (CATO +3.1%), Buckle (BKE +2.7%), Gap (GPS +2.6%), Express (EXPR +2.2%) and New York & Company (NWY +2.2%).
    •  #ICR17 updates
     
     
     
     
    | 12:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • UNH

    Analysts weigh in on UNH/SCAI deal

    • Analysts like UnitedHealth Group's (UNH -0.4%) acquisition of Surgical Health Care Affiliates (SCAI +15.9%) for $57 a share.
    • Jefferies' Brian Tanquilut says the bid is fair with competing offers unlikely due to valuation. Great strategic fit with OptumCare.
    • Evercore's Michael Newshel adds that OptumCare has "massive growth potential."
    • Cowen's Christine Arnold reiterates that OptumHealth is the "least appreciated" UNH growth factor. SCAI will supplement Optum's 175 MedExpress clinics.
    • Goldman's Matthew Borsch believes SCAI will increase OptumHealth's top line by 8% and operating income 20% before acquisition costs.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:02 PM

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    Nobillis Health, Surgery Partners on the move after Surgical Care sale

    • Up alongside are peers Nobillis Health (HLTH +4.1%) and Surgery Partners (SGRY +9.1%).
    • Also moving: Tenet Healthcare (THC +4.6%), Universal Health (UHS +2%).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:53 AM
  • BABY

    Natus expects bullish 2017; shares ahead 5%

    • On a preliminary basis, Natus Medical (BABY +4.8%) expects Q4 revenues of $107.5 - 108.0M and $381.2M - 383.2M for 2016, both in line with consensus.
    • 2017 guidance: revenues: $505.0M - 510.0M (consensus: $428.0M); non-GAAP EPS: $1.80 - 1.85 (consensus: $1.85).
    • Q1 guidance: revenues: $122.0M - 124.0M; non-GAAP EPS: $0.32 - 0.34.
    • Final 2016 results will be released before the open on February 1.
    • $JPM17
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM
  • GPN

    Global Payments spikes to all-time high

    • Global Payments (GPN +6.9%) rallies after posting a FQ2 earnings beat and setting pleasing guidance.
    • Global sees 2017 revenue of $3.35B-$3.45B and EPS of $3.70-$3.90.
    • The company also lifted its buyback authorization to $300M.
    • Previously: Global Payments beats by $0.04, beats on revenue (Jan. 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM | 1 Comment
  • ENDP

    Endo International +2.1% after JPM conference slides

    • The company reaffirms full-year guidance: revenue of $3.87B-$4.03B, adjusted gross margin about 60%, and adjusted EPS of $4.50-$4.80.
    • Also part of the talking points: Statistically significant Phase IIb results for Xiaflex in cellulite, key FTF launches of generic Seroquel and generic Zeita, and progress on the strategic review.
    • Presentation slides
    • The presentation begins at 1:30 ET.
    • ENDP +2.1%
    • #JPM17
     
     
     
     
    | 11:43 AM | 8 Comments
  • INCY

    Incyte up 7% on expanded cancer collaboration with Merck; IDO competitor NewLink up 17%

    • Incyte (INCY +6.7%) and Merck (MRK +0.4%) expand their collaboration investigating the combination of epacadostat and Keytruda (pembrolizumab) in solid tumors and blood cancers. The companies now plan to initiate pivotal studies in four additional tumor types: non-small cell lung cancer, renal cell carcinoma, bladder cancer and squamous cell carcinoma.
    • Epacadostat is a small molecule inhibitor of IDO1, an immunosuppressive enzyme that has been shown to induce regulatory T cell generation and activation thereby allowing cancer cells to avoid detection by the immune system. Pembrolizumab helps the immune system fight tumor cells by blocking the interaction between PD-1, a cell surface receptor expressed on T cells and pro-B cells, and its ligands PD-L1 and PD-L2. PD-1 is an immune checkpoint which down regulates the immune system. Blocking its action activates the immune system to attack cancer cells.
    • The good news has apparently spread to NewLink Genetics (NLNK +17.1%) who inked a development deal in October 2014 with Roche's (OTCQX:RHHBY) Genentech for IDO candidate GDC-0919.
    • #JPM17
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • PETX

    Mars deal throws a spotlight on the pet care sector

    • Shares of Artana Therapeutics (PETX +8.5%) catch a bid after pet services peer VCA Antech is bought out by Mars.
    • Artana trades at its highest level since last October.
    • A deep dive into recent trends in the pet care sector was posted on Seeking Alpha earlier today by Willow Street Investments.
    • Previously: Mars acquires VCA Antech Inc. (Jan. 9)
    • Previously: Mars-VCA deal seen sailing past regulatory review (Jan. 9)
    • Related stocks: ABC, HSIC, MWIV, PDCO, PFE, SJM, ZTS, BUFF, FRT.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:36 AM | 4 Comments
  • KERX

    Keryx Biopharma +5.4% on strong preliminary numbers

    • Q4 prescription demand was about 8.7K prescriptions, which included 4.5K for December, the first full month of sales post resupply of Auryxia. The FDA has also approved Patheon's manufacturing facility in France which will supply Auryxia to the U.S.
    • Keryx (KERX +5.4%) expects Q4 revenues of about $9.5M vs. $5.8M a year earlier. Full-year revenues should foot to $31.9M vs. $13.7M in 2015.
    • Cash and cash equivalents totaled about $112.1M at year-end.
    • The company's JPMorgan conference presentation is at 5:30 ET.
    • #JPM17
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 5 Comments

  • RDN

    Private mortgage insurers head south as FHA cuts premiums

    • Radian Group (RDN -3.4%), MGIC Investment (MTG -2.5%), Essent Group (ESNT -3.3%), NMI Holdings (NMIH -3.6%), Old Republic (ORI -0.5%), and Genworth (GNW -1.3%) all get a parting gift from the Obama administration as the FHA cuts borrowing fees by 25 basis points.
    • The meme for private mortgage insurers of late has been one in which they're seen as gaining market share thanks to the government's pulling back from the business of mortgage insurance. This fee reduction suggests the exact opposite.
    • The incoming administration, its proposed HUD Secretary Ben Carson, and the Republican congress are likely opposed to the fee reduction, but whether it actually gets reversed is a different story.

  • DWDP

    Supreme Court rejects Dow Chemical over $1B tax deduction claim

    • The U.S. Supreme Court dismisses Dow Chemical's (DOW +2.1%) attempt to revive its claim to $1B-plus in tax deductions based on partnerships the company formed that lower courts said were created primarily to avoid tax liability.
    • The Court left in place two rulings by the Fifth U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals in favor of the U.S. government over the two partnerships that ran during 1993-2003, agreeing with the IRS that Dow did not deserve the tax benefits, and also imposed a 20% penalty for negligence and understatement of taxes.

  • Rough session for pound after May's weekend comments

    • Exiting the EU will be "getting the right relationship, not about keeping bits of membership," U.K. Prime Minister Theresa May told Sky News over the weekend.
    • "The aim of controlling immigration was a red line she would not be willing to cross,” says a currency strategist, meaning the U.K. is likely to lose access to the single market once Brexit occurs.
      “A hard Brexit looks almost certain,” says UniCredit. “The only real question that remains is whether the transition will be gradual (and, hence, orderly) or abrupt."
    • The pound is lower by 1.2% to $1.2139. The FTSE 100 is ahead 0.3%.
    • ETFs: FXB, EWU, GBB, EWUS, FKU, DXPS, DBUK, QGBR, HEWU

  • SLS

    Galena subject in criminal investigation into Abstral promotional practices; shares off 18% premarket

    • Galena Biopharma (GALE) slumps 18% premarket on increased volume in response to its disclosure that the U.S. Attorney's Office for the District of New Jersey and the U.S. Department of Justice have launched a criminal investigation, in additional to a civil investigation, into the marketing and promotional practices related to opioid Abstral (fentanyl) sublingual tablets.
    • The investigation is assessing possible violations of the federal False Claims Act, the federal Anti-Kickback Statute and the federal Sunshine Act.
    • The company has received a subpoena for documents related to the criminal prosecution of two high-prescribing physicians that commenced on January 4. It says that it intends to cooperate fully with the inquiry.
